display_name: Total score of the Women's Health Initiative Insomnia Rating Scale (WHIIRS)
description:
The WHIIRS assesses insomnia symptoms (i.e., sleep latency, sleep maintenance, early morning awakening, and sleep quality). Scores range from 0 to 20. Higher scores indicate worse ratings.

Reference: [Levine, D. W., Kaplan, R. M., Kripke, D. F., Bowen, D. J., Naughton, M. J., & Shumaker, S. A. (2003). Factor structure and measurement invariance of the Women's Health Initiative Insomnia Rating Scale. Psychological Assessment, 15, 123-136.](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/12847773)
